sentences.sentence: A Story about Someone Who Wanted to be Scared( 被惊吓 )
Once upon a time there was a father who had two sons.
The elder son was smart and sensible( 明智的 ), and could do many things,
but the younger son was stupid and could neither learn nor understand anything.
When people saw him they said, “There’s someone who will give his father some trouble!”
When anything had to be done, it was always the elder son who had to do it.
But if his father told the elder son to get something after dark, and the way led through the graveyard( 墓地 ), or any other dark and lonely place,
he would say “Oh, no, father, please don’t make me go there, I’m too scared( 害怕的 )!”
Or when stories of ghosts( 鬼 ) and terrible, bloody murders( 谋杀 ) were told by the fire at night, the listeners would sometimes say “Please stop, we’re too scared!”
The younger son sat in a corner and listened with the rest of them, but he had no idea what they were talking about.
“ ‘Scared’—what does that even mean?” he thought to himself.
“Obviously being scared is just one more thing that I’m too stupid to do properly.”
One day the father said to him:
“You are growing tall and strong, and you need to find a way to earn( 挣得 ) your living. Look what a good worker your brother is already.”
“Well, father,” he replied, “I am quite willing to learn something. What I would really like to learn is how to be scared. I don’t understand that at all yet.”
The elder brother smiled when he heard that, and thought to himself, “What a stupid brother I have! He will never be good for anything useful.”
The father sighed( 叹气 ), and told his younger son, “I’m pretty sure something will happen to scare( （使）害怕 ) you soon, but that won’t help you earn your living.”
Soon after this the sexton( 教堂司事 ) came to visit the house.
The father told him how his younger son could never learn anything.
“Just think,” said he, “when I asked him how he was going to earn his bread, he actually( 实际上 ) wanted to learn how to be scared.”
“He can learn that from me.” replied the sexton.
“Send him to me, and I will soon finish his education for him.”
The father was glad to do it, for he thought, “It will give the boy some practical experience.”
The sexton therefore took him into his house, and gave him the job of ringing the church bell.
After a day or two, the sexton woke him up at midnight, and told him to go up into the church tower and ring the bell.
“I’ll soon scare him!” he thought to himself, and secretly went there before him.
When the boy was at the top of the tower and turned round, and was just going to take hold of the bell rope,
he saw a white figure standing on the stairs( 楼梯 ), in the dark.
“Who is there?” cried he, but the figure neither replied nor moved.
“Answer me,” cried the boy, “or go away.
What are you doing here in the middle of the night?”
The sexton stood there making strange sounds and waving( 挥舞 ) his arms, to make the boy think that he was a ghost.
The boy cried a second time, “What do you want here? Speak now, or I will throw you down the stairs!”
The sexton thought, “Surely he can’t mean what he says!” and so said nothing.
Then the boy asked him again, but the “ghost” still did not reply.
So the boy pushed the “ghost” down the stairs, rang the bell as he had been told to do, and went home to sleep.

article_info.share_words: The elder son was smart and sensible, and could do many things, but the younger son was stupid and could neither learn nor understand anything.

question.cn: 下列关于大儿子的说法哪一项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements about the elder son was true?

options.en: He was smart and could do many things.
He was not afraid of the dark.

analysis: 文中提到：“The elder son was smart and sensible, and could do many things.”因此A项正确；后文接着提到：But if his father told the elder son to get something after dark . . .  “Oh, no, father, please don’t make me go there, I’m too scared!” Or when stories of ghosts and terrible, bloody murders were told by the fire at night, the listeners would sometimes say “Please stop, we’re too scared!” B、C项错误，因此答案选A。

question.cn: 小儿子真正想要学的是什么？
question.en: What did the younger son really want to learn?

options.cn: 他想学怎么成为一个工人。
options.en: He wanted to learn how to be a worker.

options.cn: 他想学习怎么吓唬别人。
options.en: He wanted to learn how to scare others.
He wanted to learn how to be scared.

analysis: 文中提到：“One day the father said to him: “You are growing tall and strong, and you need to find a way to earn your living. Look what a good worker your brother is already.” “Well, father,” he replied, “I am quite willing to learn something. What I would really like to learn is how to be scared.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么教堂司事要制造怪音并挥舞自己的胳膊呢？
question.en: Why did the sexton make strange sounds and wave his arms?

options.en: Because he wanted to play a trick on the boy.
Because he went mad after dark.

options.cn: 因为他想要让男孩认为他是鬼。
options.en: Because he wanted to make the boy think he was a ghost.

analysis: 文中提到：“The sexton stood there making strange sounds and waving his arms, to make the boy think that he was a ghost.”因此答案选C。
